Memorandum of understanding with the Ministry of Transport which is considered one of the important ministries that provides various services to citizens. The project provides technical assistance to the Transport Directorate (TD) to simplify vehicle procedures and enhance its institutional capacity. Outputs delivered according to MoU are the following:

1.	Status quo study and assessment of transaction interlacement with other Ministries.
2.	Analysis and reengineering study of business processes in all TDs and adding new decision-support-related services. 
3.	Specify the re-engineered to-be system and determine the moving steps towards it as well as the way of immigrating old data to the new system.
4.	Preparing RFQ, evaluating offers, and contracting.
5.	Follow-up implementation, preliminary acceptance, operation and delivery for TDs in Damascus and Damascus countryside. 
6.	Studying the establishment of a Customer Service Centre that aims at facilitating and providing public services such as car parking, waiting rooms, queuing mechanism, and other entertainment that can remove the stress of waiting. Those centers can be in a separate place or in the ministry directorate or institution, also can be administered by the Ministry or by private sector.

memorandum of understanding (MoU) with the Ministry of Communication and Technology/Public Post Establishment (Syrian Post) considered as an important agency that provides various services to citizens and business sector. The project provides technical assistance to enhance Syrian Post institutional and administrative capacities, to computerize its main services, and to build its human resources. Output deliverables were divided into five tracks:
Track 1: Quality improvement of the supplied services 
1.	 Improve the quality of current services
2.	Develop new financial and postal services
3.	Supervision of  the implementation of these improvements.
Track 2: Human resources training and development: 
4.	Prepare and implement a continuous training plan depending on the concepts of career development plans.
5.	Prepare and implement a motivation plan by linking salaries with employee's productivity and performance. This plan might help attracting and maintaining highly-qualified human resources.
6.	Supervise the implementation of the training plan.
Track 3: Improvement of service delivery environment: 
1.	Develop and modernize citizen centers delivering postal services
2.	Develop and modernize marketing plans in order to promote postal services.
3.	Enhance and develop new postal office and centers all over the country.
4.	Develop and modernize processing tools and devices used for Postal services.
5.	Develop and modernize distribution vehicles and equipments.
Track 4: Computerization of Postal services
This track considers the computerization of the following services:  
•	Postal transfer service
•	Express Mail service
•	Official Mail service
•	Formal- paperwork correspondence service
•	Invoice payment service
Track 5: Restructuring of administrative & organizational environment: 
1.	Re-organize the administrative procedures within the establishment
2.	Modernize and develop administrative structure of the establishment.
3.	Modernize and develop the internal bylaws of the establishment
4.	Create a quality-management system that would help the establishment to obtain administrative quality certificate (ISO 9000).

Memorandum of understanding with National agency for networking services (NANS) aims to create a framework for cooperation and coordination between the Ministry of Communications and Technology (MoCT), the National Agency of Network services (NANS) and UNDP-GSR, in order to provide technical assistance for the activation of electronic-signature law in Syria and for building required capacity in accordance with the needs of the NANS in this specific area. Outputs delivered according to MoU are the following:
1.	Set-up an execution plan for implementing digital signature in Syria considering readiness environment and local needs, by focusing on consecutive implementation phases.
2.	Conduct and specify the required expertise and build ToRs to ensure execution of the above mentioned plan, participate and supervise the related contracting process.
3.	Provide expertise for supervising the establishment of PKI infrastructure as per the national plan for the activation of use of digital signature.
4.	Develop necessary recommendations to regulate the use of electronic signature during the transition period until the project of electronic signature is up and running.
5.	 Develop general technical specifications for digital-signature systems and supervise their implementation. 
6.	Specify regulations and licensing rules for root CA and supervise its implementation.
7.	Specify regulations and licensing rules for government CA and supervise its implementation.
8.	Conduct, supervise, and review the general tender book for the implementation of root and governmental CAs' systems; and follow up contracting process.
9.	Supervise the implementation and operation of root and governmental CAs' systems and their final acceptance.
10.	Specify regulations and licensing rules for public CAs and supervise their implementation.

memorandum of understanding with the Ministry of Communication and Technology-Syrian Telecommunication Establishment (STE), which is considered one of the important ministries that provides various services to citizens. The project provides technical assistance to STE to simplify procedures of service provision to citizens, and to enhance its institutional capacity as well as improving the environment of service provision. Outputs delivered according to MoU are the following:
1.	Specify a set of Key Performance Indicators (KPI) in order to evaluate existing services 
2.	Study the "as-is" situation of  customer service centers, and evaluate the centers according to predefined KPIs.
3.	Propose a mechanism to generate the proposed KPIs to continuously monitor customer service performance.
4.	Set-up an intervention plan to improve telecommunication customer service centers, including construction and environment enhancement works, as well as business process re-engineering and performance indicators generation. 
5.	Rehabilitation of 10 customer service centers.
6.	Set up of queuing systems in 13 customer service centers.
7.	Re-engineer internet provision procedures

Memorandum of understanding with the Ministry of Communication and Technology (MoCT) which is considered one of the important ministries that regulates the use of ICTs in the context of citizen services.. Outputs delivered according to MoU are the following:
1.	Conduct a survey to identify government services delivered to citizens and specify priority services based on the possibility of applying information and communication technology through the simplification process. 
2.	Carry-out a study on the status quo related to e-readiness documents available in Syria in terms of infra-structure and human resourses. Based on the study outcome, provide clear indicators to be used for undertaking a comparative assessment for Syria at  regional and international levels. 
3.	Provide a vision and a strategy to e-government project including filling up the gap of legislations and raise e-readiness.
4.	Prepare a standard framework for interoperability, taking into account the presence of different e-government systems, in order to  avoid central solutions and allow different ministries to work separately while ensuring integrity.
5.	 Increase the progress pace towards the adoption of e-governmental services, and conduct an analytical study to e-government portal. 
6.	Conduct needs' assessment to identify leading and technical competencies needed as well as, a capacities building program in order to reduce any potential resistance of change; in addition to strengthening the cooperation between general and private sectors.
7.	Suggest e-solutions for some previously studied services (pilot e-services). Two services will be selected: the first one is set-up with the Ministry of Health in accordance with current legislations and rules. The second one is set up with the Prime Ministry Office, and its implementation requires new legislations.

Memorandum of understanding (MoU) with the Ministry of Health (MoH), considered as an important agency that provides various services to citizens and business sector. The project provides technical assistance to enhance MoH institutional capacities and develop process management, and focuses on the re-engineering of processes of the MoH/directorate of registry and the Communicable and chronic diseases directorate. Outputs delivered according to MoU are as follows:
For the MoH/Directorate of Registry:
1.	The current state (as-is) of services, administrative procedures, data, as well as the infrastructure of the hardware, and telecommunication network
2.	SWOT analysis of the current situation to identify the most important challenges facing the directorate, responsible for all Syrian medical professionals and medical entities.
3.	Re-engineering proposal (to-be), of directorate processes including a conceptualization of the necessary infrastructure and  a transition plan to the targeted (to-be) system.
4.	The requirements' document, the technical specifications in accordance with the proposed future model, and mechanisms for data migration.
5.	Assist the directorate in the selection of the executing party, and the completion of the contractual procedures.
6.	Assist the directorate in supervising the implementation and follow-up.
For the Communicable and chronic diseases directorate:
1.	Study the "as-is" situation and identify main challenges including  Communicable and chronic diseases dependencies, services, processes, workflows, software, and hardware and communication infrastructure currently in use in the directorate. 
2.	Elaborate the "to-be"  situation of the services, processes, workflows, software systems, database, hardware and communication infrastructure necessary to create a national bank for communicable and chronic diseases which includes: treatments, patients and related medication dispensed by the MoH: 
3.	Propose a plan to distribute and control medicine stock and to reduce wastage taking into account the warehouse system implemented in MoH, and to create a central database to preserve medical records of patients related to diseases. 
4.	Suggest Decision-support Reports to assist decision makers.
5.	Suggest how to unify Patient Data and create EMR for chronicle and communicable diseases.
6.	Evaluate the requirements and suggest strategies to migrate and cleanse data stored in current databases in the directorate to the recommended new system.
7.	Specify the functional and non-functional requirements of the recommended system.

Memorandum of understanding (MoU) with the Ministry of Interior (MoI) that provides various valuable services to citizens. The objective is to provide consultancy to activate the Civil Affair Portal of the Ministry through the following outputs:  
1.	Review and evaluate the current status of the Civil Affair Portal, assess the integrity and level of accuracy of the database, the portal level of readiness, connectivity methods and reliability, and prepare current status report.
2.	Prepare recommended administrative and legal procedures to operate the portal and guarantee its accessibility to other Ministries while maintaining portal's security and data integrity.
3.	Prepare Security Policy for  portal access and information use, to ensure personal information privacy and prevent any misuse.
4.	Evaluate potential faults in data accuracy and specify sources of errors and recommend procedures for data cleansing.
5.	Evaluate technical requirements for portal accessibility and inter-operability with other existing government systems.
6.	Suggest, and develop APIs to assure the interoperability with other existing government systems.
